name: market for oat grain | oat grain | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/30304/documentation

This is a market activity. Each market represents the consumption mix of a product in a given geography, connecting suppliers with consumers of the same product in the same geographical area. Markets group the producers and also the imports of the product (if relevant) within the same geographical area. They also account for transport to the consumer and for the losses during that process, when relevant.;This is the market for 'oat grain', in the geography of Tasmania in Australia.;Transport from producers to consumers of this product in the geography covered by the market is included.;The product 'oat grain' is a grain. It is an annual crop.

The activity starts at the gate of oat grain cultivation farm.

This activity ends with the supply of 'oat grain', to the consumers of this product. Transport is included. Product losses during transportation are assumed negligible and are therefore not included.
category: A:Agriculture, forestry and fishing/01:Crop and animal production, hunting and related service activities/011:Growing of non-perennial crops/0111:Growing of cereals (except rice), leguminous crops and oil seeds

processDocumentation.timeDescription: The time period is the same as the in transforming activity for the same reference product.
processDocumentation.geographyDescription: Data represent the situation in Tasmania state in Australia.

exchanges.description: The crops are transported by lorry (20%) and train (80%) in a total distance of 135km in the Tasmaniastate in Australia. Transport distances based on Eady, S. (2017). Greenhouse gas emissions from the cultivation of canola oilseed in Australia, CSIRO: Clayton, Australia. With road rail mix inferred from Commonwealth of Australia (2009). Road and rail freight: competitor or complements. Information sheet 34, Australian Government, Bureau of Infrastructure, Transport and Regional Economics.
